description.narrative: Project's objective is to disseminate knowledge on the importance of mangroves and its wise use to the local communities. Sabah has the most extensive coverage of mangroves in Malaysia, which accounts for 59% of the country?s mangrove area (341,000 ha). Wh ile many countries have lost their mangrove forests, Sabah still maintains more than 90% of its original mangrove cover. Local communities at the coastal and mangroves area have been depending on its resources for their livelihoods. In addition, mangrove t rees have been commercially exploited in Sabah as early as the 1900s mainly for its tannin from the bark, firewood and charcoal, and woodchips. However, over time, mangrove habitats have been cleared and reclaimed to make way for development for housing es tates, commercial area and agriculture to keep pace with the increasing human population and high demand for agricultural products.
